intro: Psychotria santaritensis, commonly known as the Santa Rita psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is typically found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
